Pre-Game Insights: Fresh from an extremely emotionally-charged victory over England, Greece return home on Sunday, when they take on the Republic of Ireland in their next UEFA Nations League showdown.
Greece are currently leading the way at the top of the rankings by three points, having also conquered Finland and Sunday's visitors last month.
Victory for Greece on Sunday would see the former continental champions win five games on the spin for the first time since 2016.
Ireland head to Piraeus with a spring in their step following their own triumphant travails on their travels on Thursday night.
The beating of Finland marked a maiden victory as Ireland head coach for Heimir Hallgrimsson, as well as a first-ever win away from home in the Nations League for the Boys in Green.
Sunday's visitors were also outplayed by their hosts just over a month ago, falling to two second-half goals in a 2-0 loss to Greece in Dublin.
Greece head coach Ivan Jovanovic will be forced into a defensive switch for Sunday's contest, as centre-back Konstantinos Koulierakis must now serve a one-match ban.
As for Ireland, Hallgrimsson lost Cardiff City defender Callum O'Dowda to injury before the win over Finland, but the Boys in Green are otherwise in good health for the long journey to Piraeus.
Post-Match Reflections: We can only envisage Jovanovic's men making it four for four as they edge ever closer to a coveted spot in the top tier of the Nations League.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A mere 24 hours before kickoff on Thursday evening, news broke of the tragic death of former Greece international and Sheffield United right-back George Baldock, leading the 2004 European champions to request the postponement of their Nations League clash with England.
